info.title: pgEdge Control Plane API
info.description: Service for creating, modifying, and operating pgEdge databases.

post.description: Join this host to an existing cluster.

get.description: Gets the join token for this cluster.
Lists all databases in the cluster.

post.description: Creates a new database in the cluster.

get.description: Returns information about a particular database in the cluster.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to inspect.

post.description: Updates a database with the given specification.

parameters.name: force_update
parameters.description: Force update the database even if the spec is the same.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to update.

delete.description: Deletes a database from the cluster.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to delete.

post.description: Initiates a backup for a database.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to back up.

parameters.name: node_name
parameters.description: Name of the node to back up.

get.description: Lists all tasks for a database.

parameters.name: after_task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task to start from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to return.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to list tasks for.

get.description: Returns information about a particular task for a database.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to inspect tasks for.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task to inspect.

get.description: Returns the log of a particular task for a database.

parameters.name: after_line_id
parameters.description: ID of the line to start from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of lines to return.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: ID of the database to get task log for.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task to get log for.

get.description: Lists all hosts within the cluster.
Returns information about a particular host in the cluster.

parameters.name: host_id
parameters.description: ID of the host to inspect.

delete.description: Removes a host from the cluster.

parameters.name: host_id
parameters.description: ID of the host to remove.

provider.description: The backup provider for this backup configuration.

repositories.description: The repositories for this backup configuration.

schedules.description: The schedules for this backup configuration.

azure_account.description: The Azure account name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_container.description: The Azure container name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_endpoint.description: The optional Azure endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_key.description: An optional Azure storage account access key to use for this repository. If not provided, pgbackrest will use the VM's managed identity.

base_path.description: The base path within the repository to store backups.

custom_options.description: Additional options to apply to this repository.

gcs_bucket.description: The GCS bucket name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'gcs'.

gcs_endpoint.description: The optional GCS endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 'gcs'.

gcs_key.description: Optional base64-encoded private key data. If omitted, pgbackrest will use the service account attached to the instance profile.

id.description: The unique identifier of this repository.

retention_full.description: The count of full backups to retain or the time to retain full backups.

retention_full_type.description: The type of measure used for retention_full.

s3_bucket.description: The S3 bucket name for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

s3_endpoint.description: The optional S3 endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

s3_key.description: An optional AWS access key ID to use for this repository. If not provided, pgbackrest will use the default credential provider chain.

s3_key_secret.description: The corresponding secret for the AWS access key ID in s3_key.

s3_region.description: The region of the S3 bucket for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

cron_expression.description: The cron expression for this schedule.

id.description: The unique identifier for this backup schedule.

type.description: The type of backup to take on this schedule.

hosts.description: All of the hosts in the cluster.

id.description: Unique identifier for the cluster.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the cluster's owner.

token.description: Token to join an existing cluster.

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

error.description: Error message from any errors that occurred during the health check.

healthy.description: Indicates if the component is healthy.

fault.description: Is the error a server-side fault?

id.description: ID is a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

message.description: Message is a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

name.description: Name is the name of this class of errors.

fault.description: Is the error a server-side fault?

id.description: ID is a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

message.description: Message is a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

name.description: Name is the name of this class of errors.

fault.description: Is the error a server-side fault?

id.description: ID is a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

message.description: Message is a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

name.description: Name is the name of this class of errors.

created_at.description: The time that the database was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the database.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the databases's owner.

updated_at.description: The time that the database was last updated.

ControlPlaneDatabaseResponseAbbreviatedC.title: Mediatype identifier: database; type=collection; view=abbreviated
ControlPlaneDatabaseResponseAbbreviatedC.description: ControlPlaneDatabaseResponseAbbreviatedCollection is the result type for an array of DatabaseResponseAbbreviated (default view)

created_at.description: The time that the database was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the database.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the databases's owner.

updated_at.description: The time that the database was last updated.

id.description: Unique identifier for the database.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the databases's owner.

cpus.description: The number of CPUs to allocate for the database on this node and to use for tuning Postgres. Defaults to the number of available CPUs on the host. Can include an SI suffix, e.g. '500m' for 500 millicpus. Whether this limit will be enforced depends on the orchestrator.

host_ids.description: The IDs of the hosts that should run this node. When multiple hosts are specified, one host will chosen as a primary and the others will be read replicas.

memory.description: The amount of memory in SI or IEC notation to allocate for the database on this node and to use for tuning Postgres. Defaults to the total available memory on the host. Whether this limit will be enforced depends on the orchestrator.

name.description: The name of the database node.

port.description: The port used by the Postgres database for this node. Overrides the Postgres port set in the DatabaseSpec.

postgres_version.description: The major version of Postgres for this node. Overrides the Postgres version set in the DatabaseSpec.

postgresql_conf.description: Additional postgresql.conf settings for this particular node. Will be merged with the settings provided by control-plane.

storage_class.description: The storage class to use for the database on this node. The possible values and defaults depend on the orchestrator.

storage_size.description: The size of the storage for this node in SI or IEC notation. Support for this value depends on the orchestrator and storage class.

created_at.description: The time that the database was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the database.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the databases's owner.

updated_at.description: The time that the database was last updated.

cpus.description: The number of CPUs to allocate for the database and to use for tuning Postgres. Defaults to the number of available CPUs on the host. Can include an SI suffix, e.g. '500m' for 500 millicpus. Whether this limit will be enforced depends on the orchestrator.

database_name.description: The name of the Postgres database.

database_users.description: The users to create for this database.

features.description: The feature flags for this database.

memory.description: The amount of memory in SI or IEC notation to allocate for the database and to use for tuning Postgres. Defaults to the total available memory on the host. Whether this limit will be enforced depends on the orchestrator.

nodes.description: The Spock nodes for this database.

port.description: The port used by the Postgres database.

postgres_version.description: The major version of the Postgres database.

postgresql_conf.description: Additional postgresql.conf settings. Will be merged with the settings provided by control-plane.

spock_version.description: The major version of the Spock extension.

storage_class.description: The storage class to use for the database. The possible values and defaults depend on the orchestrator.

storage_size.description: The size of the storage in SI or IEC notation. Support for this value depends on the orchestrator and storage class.

items.example: Dolor blanditiis modi omnis sit est.

attributes.description: The attributes to assign to this database user.

db_owner.description: If true, this user will be granted database ownership.

password.description: The password for this database user.

roles.description: The roles to assign to this database user.

username.description: The username for this database user.

cpus.description: The number of CPUs on this host.

id.description: Unique identifier for the host.

ipv4_address.description: The IPv4 address of this host.

memory.description: The amount of memory available on this host.

orchestrator.description: The orchestrator used by this host.

supported_pgedge_versions.description: The PgEdge versions supported by this host.

cohort_id.description: The cohort ID that the host belongs to.

control_available.description: Indicates if the host is a control node in the cohort.

member_id.description: The member ID of the host within the cohort.

type.description: The type of cohort that the host belongs to.

components.description: The status of each component of the host.

updated_at.description: The last time the host status was updated.

host_id.description: The ID of the host this instance is running on.

id.description: Unique identifier for the instance.

node_name.description: The Spock node name for this instance.

InstanceResponseAbbreviatedCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: instance; type=collection; view=default
InstanceResponseAbbreviatedCollection.description: InstanceResponseAbbreviatedCollection is the result type for an array of InstanceResponseAbbreviated (default view)

host_id.description: The ID of the host this instance is running on.

id.description: Unique identifier for the instance.

node_name.description: The Spock node name for this instance.

InstanceResponseBodyAbbreviatedCollectio.title: Mediatype identifier: instance; type=collection; view=default
InstanceResponseBodyAbbreviatedCollectio.description: InstanceResponseBodyAbbreviatedCollection is the result type for an array of InstanceResponseBodyAbbreviated (default view)

provider.description: The backup provider for this restore configuration.

restore_options.description: Additional options to use when restoring this database. If omitted, the database will be restored to the latest point in the given repository.

source_database_id.description: The ID of the database to restore this database from.

source_database_name.description: The name of the database in this repository. This database will be renamed to the database_name in the DatabaseSpec.

source_node_name.description: The name of the node to restore this database from.

azure_account.description: The Azure account name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_container.description: The Azure container name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_endpoint.description: The optional Azure endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 'azure'.

azure_key.description: An optional Azure storage account access key to use for this repository. If not provided, pgbackrest will use the VM's managed identity.

base_path.description: The base path within the repository where backups are stored.

custom_options.description: Additional options to apply to this repository.

gcs_bucket.description: The GCS bucket name for this repository. Only applies when type = 'gcs'.

gcs_endpoint.description: The optional GCS endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 'gcs'.

gcs_key.description: Optional base64-encoded private key data. If omitted, pgbackrest will use the service account attached to the instance profile.

id.description: The unique identifier of this repository.

s3_bucket.description: The S3 bucket name for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

s3_endpoint.description: The optional S3 endpoint for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

s3_key.description: An optional AWS access key ID to use for this repository. If not provided, pgbackrest will use the default credential provider chain.

s3_key_secret.description: The corresponding secret for the AWS access key ID in s3_key.

s3_region.description: The region of the S3 bucket for this repository. Only applies when type = 's3'.

completed_at.description: The time when the task was completed.

created_at.description: The time when the task was created.

database_id.description: The database ID of the task.

error.description: The error message if the task failed.

task_id.description: The unique ID of the task.

database_id.description: The database ID of the task log.

last_line_id.description: The ID of the last line in the task log.

items.example: Unde ex natus eligendi consequatur molestiae officiis.

lines.description: The lines of the task log.

task_id.description: The unique ID of the task log.

tenant_id.description: Unique identifier for the databases's owner.
